title: Family of Kamala Harris
added: Douglas Emhoff is the husband of Kamala Harris. He was born to Jewish parents,<ref>{{Cite web|last=Emmrich|first=Stuart|title=The 9 Things We Know About Kamala Harris's Husband|url=https://www.vogue.com/article/nine-things-we-know-about-kamala-harris-husband-douglas-emhoff|access-date=2020-08-19|website=Vogue|language=en-us}}</ref> Michael and Barbara Emhoff, in [[Brooklyn]], [[New York (state)|New York]]. He lived in [[New Jersey]] from 1969 to 1981, moving with his family to California when he was 17.<ref name="app-nj">{{cite news|last1=Davis|first1=Mike|date=12 August 2020|title=Kamala Harris' husband, Douglas Emhoff, has 'NJ in his veins'|newspaper=[[Asbury Park Press]]|url=https://www.app.com/story/news/politics/2020/08/12/kamala-harris-joe-biden-douglas-emhoff-vice-president/3356770001/|access-date=12 August 2020}}</ref><ref name="cnn-what-to-know">{{cite news|last1=Reston|first1=Maeve|date=June 3, 2019|title=What to know about Douglas Emhoff, Kamala Harris' husband, after that onstage protester moment|website=CNN|url=https://www.cnn.com/2019/06/02/politics/who-is-douglas-emhoff-kamala-harris-husband/index.html|access-date=August 11, 2020}}</ref><ref name=":02">{{Cite web|last=Friedman|first=Gabe|date=August 11, 2020|title=Kamala Harris is Joe Biden's VP pick - here's what Jewish voters should know|url=https://www.jta.org/2020/08/11/politics/kamala-harris-is-joe-bidens-vp-pick-heres-what-jewish-voters-should-know|access-date=August 12, 2020|language=en-US|agency=[[Jewish Telegraphic Agency]]}}</ref> Emhoff graduated from the [[California State University, Northridge]] and [[USC Gould School of Law]].<ref name="thr-first">{{cite magazine|last1=Cullins|first1=Ashley|date=March 29, 2019|title=First Gentleman? Kamala Harris' Attorney Husband Talks 'Endlessly Fascinating' Campaign Trail|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/kamala-harris-attorney-husband-talks-fascinating-campaign-trail-1197098|magazine=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|access-date=August 11, 2020}}</ref> Emhoff is an entertainment litigator and began his career at Pillsbury Winthrop's litigation group. He later moved to Belin Rawlings & Badal, a boutique firm, in the late 1990s. He opened his own firm with Ben Whitwell in 2000. The firm was acquired by [[Venable LLP|Venable]] in 2006. Emhoff is now employed by [[DLA Piper]], working at its [[Washington, D.C.]], and [[California]] offices.<ref name="ap-growing">{{cite news|last1=Summers|first1=Juana|date=June 8, 2019|title=Harris' husband takes on growing public role in 2020 race|work=[[Associated Press]]|url=https://apnews.com/1b5e33b807fe48fb9d7e7bcc79547af7|access-date=August 11, 2020}}</ref> Emhoff was married for 16 years to film producer [[Kerstin Emhoff]] n√©e Mackin. They have two children.<ref>{{Cite magazine|last=Harris|first=Kamala|date=May 10, 2019|title=Sen. Kamala Harris on Being 'Momala'|url=https://www.elle.com/culture/career-politics/a27422434/kamala-harris-stepmom-mothers-day/|magazine=[[Elle (magazine)|Elle]]|access-date=August 12, 2020}}</ref><ref name=":02"/> He married Harris on August 22, 2014, in [[Santa Barbara, California]], with Harris's sister [[Maya Harris]] officiating.<ref>{{cite news|last=Siders|first=David|date=August 25, 2014|title=Kamala Harris married in Santa Barbara ceremony|work=[[The Sacramento Bee]]|url=https://www.sacbee.com/news/politics-government/capitol-alert/article2607685.html}}</ref>

Cole Emhoff is the stepson of Kamala Harris through her marriage to Doug Emhoff.<ref name=":1">{{Cite web|last=Jean-Philippe|first=McKenzie|date=2020-08-12|title=Sen. Kamala Harris's Step-Kids Call Her "Momala"|url=https://www.oprahmag.com/life/a33584791/kamala-harris-children/|access-date=2020-08-19|website=Oprah Magazine|language=en-US}}</ref> He was born September 15, 1994 and is named after jazz musician [[John Coltrane]].<ref name = elle>{{cite news|url=https://www.elle.com/culture/career-politics/a27422434/kamala-harris-stepmom-mothers-day/|title=Sen. Kamala Harris On Being 'Momala'|last=Harris|first=Kamala|date=May 10, 2019|work=Elle|access-date=23 August 2020}}</ref> Emhoff graduated from [[Colorado College]] with a bachelor's degree in psychology. Emhoff was an assistant at [[William Morris Endeavor]] before becoming an [[executive assistant]] at [[Plan B Entertainment]]. Emhoff calls Harris "Momala".<ref>{{Cite web|last=Pomarico|first=Nicole|date=2020-08-13|title=Who Is Cole Emhoff, Kamala Harris's Stepson?|url=https://www.yourtango.com/2020336303/who-kamala-harris-stepson-cole-emhoff|access-date=2020-08-19|website=YourTango|language=en}}</ref>

Ella Emhoff is the stepdaughter of Kamala Harris through her marriage to Douglas Emhoff. She was born May 29, 1999 and is named after jazz singer [[Ella Fitzgerald]].<ref name=":1" /> In 2014, she was in the music video for [[Bo Burnham]]'s song "Repeat Stuff". In 2018, Emhoff graduated from high school in Los Angeles where she was on the swim team.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Pomarico|first=Nicole|date=2020-08-13|title=Who Is Ella Emhoff, Kamala Harris's Stepdaughter?|url=https://www.yourtango.com/2020336310/who-kamala-harris-stepdaughter-ella-emhoff|access-date=2020-08-19|website=YourTango|language=en}}</ref> She is an artist [[majoring]] in apparel and textiles at [[Parsons School of Design]]. Emhoff calls Harris "Momala".<ref name=":1" /> She designed her [[inauguration day]] dress with designer [[Batsheva Hay]].<ref>{{Cite web|last=Specter|first=Emma|title=How Ella Emhoff and Batsheva Hay Came Up With An Inauguration-Worthy Dress|url=https://www.vogue.com/article/ella-emhoff-inauguration-dress-2021|access-date=2021-01-20|website=Vogue|language=en-us}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|last=Goldberg|first=Carrie|date=2021-01-20|title=Ella Emhoff Wears Miu Miu and Batsheva to the Inauguration|url=https://www.harpersbazaar.com/fashion/designers/a35267494/ella-emhoff-inauguration-coat-style-2021/|access-date=2021-01-20|website=Harper's BAZAAR|language=en-US}}</ref>
